intro: Senecio bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá senecio, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, mountainous habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio bogotensis is adapted to cool, temperate climates and is often found in alpine meadows.
